A Message to the Carnegie Endowment Community Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/06/04/message-to-carnegie-endowment-community-pub-81981

  • William J. Burns Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1014

Wed Jun 03 2020 20:00:00 GMT-0400 (EDT)

The murder of George Floyd has underscored the deep inequities that have long plagued American society. In a note to the Carnegie community, Bill Burns reflects on Carnegie’s commitment to build a more just future here at home and around the world, without which peace will remain beyond our grasp.

Global Pandemic: Coronavirus and Global Disorder Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/specialprojects/coronavirus

regularly updated collection

Mon Mar 16 2020 20:00:00 GMT-0400 (EDT)

As the deadly coronavirus disrupts daily life around the world, Carnegie experts offer analysis on the political, economic, and geostrategic effects of the global pandemic.

The United States and the New World Disorder: Retreat From Primacy Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/05/21/united-states-and-new-world-disorder-retreat-from-primacy-pub-81876

  • Aaron David Miller Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1744
  • , Richard Sokolsky Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1038

commentary

Wed May 20 2020 20:00:00 GMT-0400 (EDT)

The coronavirus pandemic has brought the era of highly ambitious U.S. diplomacy to an unceremonious end. As U.S. power wanes, is Washington ready for a world that has never needed it more and trusted it less?

Topics Discussed
  • United States Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/regions/112
  • Foreign Policy Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/topic/1296?lang=en
  • On the PandemicWilliam J. Burns Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1014 explains how the coronavirus presents a make-or-break moment for U.S. diplomacy Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/04/06/make-or-break-test-for-american-diplomacy-pub-81477
  • On the United StatesWilliam J. Burns Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1014 discusses the need for a rebirth of U.S. public service Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/05/04/america-needs-rebirth-of-public-service-pub-81713

U.S. Foreign Policy for the Middle Class: Perspectives From Nebraska Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/05/21/u.s.-foreign-policy-for-middle-class-perspectives-from-nebraska-pub-81767

  • Salman Ahmed Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1322
  • , Allison Gelman, eds.

report

Wed May 20 2020 20:00:00 GMT-0400 (EDT)

As millions of Americans contend with lost wages and savings due to the coronavirus, the challenge of making U.S. foreign policy work harder for the middle class is even more vital.

Topics Discussed
  • United States Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/regions/112
  • Foreign Policy Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/topic/1296
  • On Colorado The task force looks at how U.S. foreign policy impacts people in Colorado Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2019/11/05/u.s.-foreign-policy-for-middle-class-perspectives-from-colorado-pub-80112
  • On Ohio The task force looks at how U.S. foreign policy impacts people in Ohio Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2018/12/10/u.s.-foreign-policy-for-middle-class-perspectives-from-ohio-pub-77779

Contentious Politics in the Syrian Conflict: Opposition, Representation, and Resistance Link: https://carnegie-mec.org/2020/05/15/contentious-politics-in-syrian-conflict-opposition-representation-and-resistance-pub-81798

  • Maha Yahya Link: https://carnegie-mec.org/experts/926

Compendium

Wed May 20 2020 20:00:00 GMT-0400 (EDT)

The Assad regime’s instinct to survive at any cost closed off opportunities for change in Syria, yet contentious politics was possible and is still taking place.

  • Syria Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/regions/187

article

Palestinian grassroots organizations are leading the response to the coronavirus pandemic. Many factors will weigh on this new activism’s longevity.

America Needs a Rebirth of Public Service Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/05/04/america-needs-rebirth-of-public-service-pub-81713

  • William J. Burns Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1014

Atlantic

Sun Feb 23 2020 19:00:00 GMT-0500 (EST)

If ever there were a moment to call Americans to serve, it’s now. To help ensure they answer that call, it’s time to end the war on government, revive U.S. institutions, and shape a new era of public service.

Topics Discussed
  • Americas Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/regions/108?lang=en
  • United States Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/regions/112?lang=en
  • Foreign Policy Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/topic/1296?lang=en
  • Economy Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/topic/1287?lang=en
  • On the United States George Perkovich Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/145 critiques the state department’s nuclear posture clarification Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/05/06/critiquing-state-department-s-nuclear-posture-clarification-pub-81722
  • On Foreign Policy Dan Baer Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1803 explains why the political campaigns must go on, even during a pandemic Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/04/02/political-campaigns-must-go-on-and-they-still-need-you-even-during-pandemic-pub-81469

Can the Coronavirus Heal Polarization? Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/05/01/can-coronavirus-heal-polarization-pub-81704

  • Rachel Kleinfeld Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/699
  • , Ashley Quarcoo Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1748

article

Thu Jan 30 2020 19:00:00 GMT-0500 (EST)

Polarization is straining democracies around the world, but effective governance and mobilization during the crisis could help narrow social divides.

Topics Discussed
  • Democracy and Governance Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/topic/1286?lang=en
  • Political Reform Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/topic/1298?lang=en
  • On Democracy and Governance William J. Burns Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1014 explains why America needs a rebirth of public service Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/05/04/america-needs-rebirth-of-public-service-pub-81713
  • On Political Reform Marc Pierini Link: https://carnegie-mec.org/diwan/experts/758 looks into Turkey’s looming Gordian knot Link: https://carnegie-mec.org/diwan/81717

Is It a Nuke?: Pre-Launch Ambiguity and Inadvertent Escalation Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/04/09/is-it-nuke-pre-launch-ambiguity-and-inadvertent-escalation-pub-81446

  • James M. Acton Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/434

Thu Jan 30 2020 19:00:00 GMT-0500 (EST)

It’s becoming increasingly difficult to distinguish a nuclear weapon from a conventional one. The risk of misidentifying either—especially prior to its launch—is an underappreciated and growing danger. At a time of geopolitical uncertainty, this confusion could spark a nuclear war.

Topics Discussed
  • Americas Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/regions/108?lang=en
  • Russia Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/regions/303?lang=en
  • Foreign Policy Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/topic/1296?lang=en
  • Nuclear Weapons Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/434
  • On Nuclear Weapons Ulrich Kuhn Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1265 discusses nuclear risk in the Euro-Atlantic Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/04/20/nuclear-risk-in-euro-atlantic-pub-81604
  • On Foreign Policy David Whineray Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/experts/1734 details how Trump’s actions allowed China to gain huge global influence Link: https://carnegieendowment.org/2020/04/17/trump-s-actions-allowed-china-to-gain-huge-global-influence.-but-coronavirus-has-gifted-him-opportunity-pub-81589
